## Key Commands
- `Ctrl + Shift + k`: compile document
- `Ctrl + Enter`: run code
- `Ctrl + Shift + Enter`: run cell

The only way to learn is by doing. You are encouraged to vandalize this document. As the instructor goes through the document, feel free to play with the document yourself. Make your own examples, re-compile the document to see the results. 

## Introduction to Markdown

Use `# HEADING` to make a heading.

Use `## SUBHEADING` to make a subheading.

Use `**TEXT**` to make text **bold**.

Use `_TEXT_` or `*TEXT*` to make text *italic*.

Use `$E = MC^2$` to write math inline: $E = MC^2$.

Use `$$ E = MC^2 $$` to write math in display mode: $$E = MC^2$$

Use \`CODE\` to show code: `x = 2 + 2` (This does not run code).

Use backslash (`\`) to escape special characters (e.g. \$, \\, \*, \_, \`)

My favorite Greek letter is \\alpha

Use `[TEXT](URL)` to make a [hyperlink](https://quarto.org/)

Use `![CAPTION](URL)` to make an image.
